meanings.definition: The ability to use; the right to use.
examples: Although computers seem to be everywhere in the United States, many people in the world do not have access to a computer at home or at school.

images.alt: Photo of cat going through small door.
images.description: A cat going through a very small door that is embedded in a larger door.
images.caption: The small cat door gives this animal easy access to going in or out.

examples: The Civil Rights Movement helped guarantee that all American citizens would be treated equally.

images.alt: Photo of two people shaking hands.
images.caption: Shaking hands is one way to be civil to another person.

examples: Andrea won the spelling bee despite the fact that she had little time to prepare.

meanings.definition: To make part of; to combine.
examples: During the Civil Rights Movement, schools were integrated so that children of all races could study together.
The community tried to promote the use of bicycles by adding bike lanes to many streets.

images.alt: Photo of sign saying, "You got this."
images.description: Sign with the encouraging message that says, You got this.
images.caption: This sign is trying to promote a positive attitude for whomever reads it.

examples: The field trip will happen on a certain date in the future.

images.alt: Photo of a tall cylinder with marks and numbers on the side.
images.description: A tall, cylinder with many markings and labels on the side. Markings include measures for cups, tablespoons, and milliliters.
images.caption: The markings on this cup help make measuring very precise.

examples: The field trip will happen on some date in the future.

meanings.definition: Not suitable or right in the circumstances.
examples: It would be improper for me to laugh when someone else is sad.

meanings.definition: Not suitable or right in the circumstances.
examples: It would be inappropriate for me to laugh when someone else is sad.

meanings.definition: Not suitable or right in the circumstances.

The U.S. Government has banned imports of elephant ivory.

images.alt: Photo of a sign on a counter.
images.description: A sign on a counter shows a drawing of a cell phone with a circle and a diagonal line through it, showing that the cell phone is not allowed. The sign says, "No cell phone use at counter. Thank you!"
images.caption: Businesses can choose to stop people from using cell phones while they are in their building.

source.title: No Cell Phone Use Prohibited Sign
source.author: JeepersMedia

meanings.definition: Exposure to the chance of injury or danger.
examples: Texting while driving is a risk for everyone

images.alt: Photo of highway covered in water.
images.description: A wide road flooded with deep water. The road goes under a bridge, and the water comes close to the bottom of the bridge. It would be dangerous to try to pass through the water because it is so deep.
images.caption: Deep water on roads can be dangerous.
